video.title: TEDTalks: Beasts, Bugs & Bio-wilderment
video.synopsis: These discussions unpack new ideas about creatures great and small, and the stories behind these organisms' past, present and struggles.

episodes.synopsis: David Gallo shows footage of amazing sea creatures, including a Times Square's worth of neon light displays from fish.
episodes.title: David Gallo Shows Underwater Astonishments

episodes.synopsis: Marcel Dicke makes an appetizing case for adding insects to everyone's diet.
episodes.title: Marcel Dicke: Why Not Eat Insects?

episodes.synopsis: Diving under the Antarctic ice to get close to the much-feared leopard seal, a photographer found an amazing new friend.
episodes.title: Paul Nicklen: Tales of Ice-Bound Wonderlands

episodes.synopsis: A biologist shares video of some captivating critters. How do nanobristle-packed feet let geckos run straight up walls?
episodes.title: Robert Full: On Animal Movement

episodes.synopsis: A virus hunter tries to discover deadly new viruses before they claim millions of lives.
episodes.title: Nathan Wolfe's Jungle Search for Viruses

episodes.synopsis: A bonobo researcher questions how much of what a species can do is determined by biology vs. by cultural exposure.
episodes.title: Susan Savage-Rumbaugh: Real Life Culture of Bonobos

episodes.synopsis: As biologist E.O. Wilson accepts his 2007 TED Prize, he makes a plea on behalf of all creatures that we learn more about our biosphere.
episodes.title: E.O. Wilson on Saving Life on Earth

episodes.synopsis: Cheryl Hayashi shows why spider silk is super-strong and super-flexible, and how this material can inspire.
episodes.title: Cheryl Hayashi: The Magnificence of Spider Silk

episodes.synopsis: A filmmaker shows the intricate world of pollen and pollinators with gorgeous high-speed images.
episodes.title: Louie Schwartzberg: The Hidden Beauty of Pollination

episodes.synopsis: Plants behave in some oddly intelligent ways. A botanist suggests that plants may have a form of intelligence of their own.
episodes.title: Stefano Mancuso: The Roots of Plant Intelligence

episodes.synopsis: Rachel Sussman shows photographs of the world's oldest continuously living organisms.
episodes.title: Rachel Sussman: The World's Oldest Living Things

episodes.synopsis: A marine biologist discovers that a plain little dragonfly had the longest migratory journey of any insect in the world.
episodes.title: Charles Anderson Discovers Dragonflies That Cross Oceans

episodes.synopsis: Bees are dying in droves. An apiarist looks at their important place in nature and the mystery behind their disappearance.
episodes.title: Dennis vanEngelsdorp: A Plea for Bees

episodes.synopsis: Jonathan Drori shows the extraordinary ways flowering plants have evolved to attract insects to spread their pollen.
episodes.title: Jonathan Drori: The Beautiful Tricks of Flowers

episodes.synopsis: The primatologist says the only real difference between humans and chimps is our sophisticated language.
episodes.title: Jane Goodall on What Separates Us from the Apes

episodes.synopsis: Bart Weetjens talks about his extraordinary project to train rats to sniff out land mines.
episodes.title: Bart Weetjens: How I Taught Rats to Sniff Out Land Mines

episodes.synopsis: Dyan deNapoli tells the story of the world's largest volunteer animal rescue, which saved more than 40,000 penguins.
episodes.title: Dyan deNapoli: The Great Penguin Rescue

episodes.synopsis: Raptor biologist Munir Virani says we need to pay more attention to vultures to change our perception and save these misunderstood creatures.
episodes.title: Munir Virani: Why I Love Vultures

episodes.synopsis: Marcus Byrne presents how dung beetles have hardwired solutions to the challenges posed by their environments. Could they help humans solve problems?
episodes.title: Marcus Byrne: The Dance of the Dung Beetle

episodes.synopsis: Haydn Parry's company has an idea to stop the rapid spread of dengue fever: genetically engineering male mosquitoes to make their offspring unviable.
episodes.title: Hadyn Parry: Re-engineering Mosquitos to Fight Disease

episodes.synopsis: Biologist Michael Dickinson looks at how a fruit fly takes flight with such delicate wings. But the secret ingredient? The incredible fly brain.
episodes.title: Michael Dickinson: How a Fly Flies

episodes.synopsis: Oceanographer and inventor Edith Widder shares the key insight -- and the teamwork -- that helped capture the giant squid on film for the first time.
episodes.title: Edith Widder: How We Found the Giant Squid

episodes.synopsis: Stewart Brand says we have the technology (and the biology) to bring back species that humanity wiped out. So -- should we?
episodes.title: Stewart Brand: The Dawn of De-extinction - Are You Ready?
